key_title: Key to the species of Frankenia

source.author: Entwisle, T.J.
source.title: Frankeniaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: From: Entwisle, T.J. (1996). Frankeniaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Petioles absent or to 0.7 mm long, not or hardly tapering distally; north-western Victoria only
Petioles 0.4–2.7 mm long, tapering or markedly narrowed distally
Revolute leaf-margins leaving gap through which midrib is prominent and raised; ovules c. 14–40 per carpel
Revolute leaf-margins almost meeting, midrib inconspicuous or only slightly raised, linear; ovules 2–3 per carpel
Branch-hairs appressed; petioles more or less cylindrical just below lamina
Branch-hairs spreading (sometimes with curved tips); petioles more or less flattened throughout

Leaves c. 1–2 mm wide, upper surface glabrous or with few scattered hairs; stem-hairs c. 0.1–0.2 mm long (hardly visible under x10 hand lens); ovules 6–18 per carpel; coastal saltmarsh and north to Horsham in western Victoria

Leaves 1–8 mm wide, upper surface glabrous or densely hairy (if glabrous then stem-hairs c 0 5 mm long or more and clearly visible with x10 hand lens); ovules 2–3 per carpel; north of Dimboola area only
